lexUnit.name: offend.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel hurt or resentful.

sentence.text: I was so offended by her behaviour towards me that tears came to my eyes .
The very name of the movement offended her .
My sigh has evidently offended her .
I wondered if I had offended him in some way .
Words such as tramp , hobo and vagrant offended him , terms bandied about by an unsympathetic society .
The theatricality of the thing offended him .
She said , by the shape of me she wanted to ask me , but she did n't want to in case she offended me .
Nor did I meet you here to be angry with you , I hope I have not so offended you that you refuse to officiate and give us your instructions here tomorrow
This was made very clear to me early in my fieldwork when I offended a neighbour by trying to make explicit return of food that had been given to my wife and me .
I 'm not offending you by what I 've been saying ? "
On 28 August 1726 John Wesley offended his father with a sermon on charity that obliquely criticized his treatment of Hetty .
Mrs Thatcher did n't like him -- particularly after he offended the Israelis with his famous attack on an Army officer on an official visit to the occupied Gaza strip .
He offended the king in some way and was summarily hanged , appearing since as a shaggy man , wearing a great set of stag 's horns and blowing a trumpet .
Those who offended the girls in some way were paid back with interest .
But the Hallstein Plan offended de Gaulle on two counts .

However , the evangelical element in the DUP refuses to cultivate such links and occasionally offends the ordinary Protestant voter by taking what appears to the general unionist public as an ` extreme " stand .
Could I risk offending Lord Lane ?
Pat Morley , producer of RTE 's major youth programme Beatbox , said : ` It 's a bit over the top for us , it might offend viewers . "
If they would be offended by an offer of money , the occasional ( money-saving ) gift to them might be very welcome .
Emerson was offended by these suggestions and reacted with characteristic vehemence .

De Gaulle was also disappointed with West German policy after Adenauer 's resignation from office in 1963 and was especially offended by German interest in an American plan for a ` Multilateral Nuclear Force " in NATO .
Hugh was deeply offended by the suggestion .
Are shoppers really going to be offended by a ponytail ?
She was also offended that a young man as charming and eligible as Lord John should flaunt his foolishness .
I do n't think we need to worry ourselves about people being offended .
Because he did n't want to offend his mum and dad , devout Catholics .
The evident squabble over the country 's soul is bound to offend those who stubbornly express the wish that religion and politics should be kept in discreet compartments .
The princess was not offended by such insistence .
An obvious lie , but the Doctor had not meant to offend .
